title: Creator of rupee symbol refuses to be drawn into controversy over new logo in Tamil Nadu
content: IIT Guwahati Professor D. Udaya Kumar discusses Tamil Nadu’s new rupee logo, designed by him, amid controversy

title: UoH students stage day-long protest against the proposed auction at Kancha Gachibowli
content: Presence of police in large numbers prevented participation from outsiders, who were denied permission to enter the campus

title: Swanky new bus terminus to be constructed on 3.5 acres in Sholinghur at a cost of ₹20 cr.
content: The new spacious terminus will have a waiting hall for commuters, bus bays, a commercial complex, parking lots, a public announcement system, digital time display boards, a time-keeper’s office, water taps, toilets and ramps for people with disabilities.

title: 164 Shakthi teams constituted to tackle crimes against women, children in Andhra Pradesh
content: Inter-State meeting to be held in Visakhapatnam to check smuggling of ganja and other drugs, says DGP Harish Kumar Gupta

title: After Ratnagiri mosque gates rammed during religious procession, police say there was no forcible entry
content: Police file FIR for sloganeering, unlawful assembly; misleading reel deleted, say police; AIMIM slams government for attack on mosque in police presence; local lawyer seeks stronger action

title: ED searches reveal large-scale fraud involving distillery companies
content: Serious irregularities found in the award of tenders, sale of liquor bottles over and above MRP, says Central agency

title: A British surgeon’s documentation of the flora in 17th Century Madras
content: Samuel Browne travelled to several locations around Fort St. George in 1696 and collected 316 specimens. He labelled each with local names and listed the traditional uses of the plants, which he is said to have learned from Tamil-and Telugu-speaking doctors

title: BJP MLC accuses Opposition leaders of blackmailing rice mill owners
content: The issue came to light after Mr. Fuke submitted video and audio clips to Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis, urging a comprehensive investigation into the matter

title: Jaishankar meets fishermen from Tamil Nadu, promises ‘full support in consular cases’
content: The meeting acquires significance as it comes against the backdrop of India’s “strong protest” against the January 28 firing by the Sri Lankan Navy on 13 Indian fishermen

title: Good sleep is a struggle for many startup founders, business leaders: survey
content: More than 26% of professionals said they are getting less than six hours of sleep in the night, a problem even more pronounced among entrepreneurs

title: A school that has been training police recruits in Tamil Nadu since 1896
content:
The police force was established in the Madras Presidency after the Madras Police Act, 1859, was passed. The first Police Training School was established in Vellore in April 1896. It was shifted to a sprawling campus at Ashok Nagar in Madras in 1976. The first batch of 77 women sub-inspectors passed out of the Ashok  
Nagar campus in 1982

title: Odisha man kills two minor sons when they oppose his remarry decision
content: Grandmother of two children participated in the heinous crime to remove obstacle for his son’s remarriage

title: A decades-old school that empowers women and denounces untouchability
content: Freedom fighter Sardar Vedarathinam Pillai started Kasthurba Gandhi Kanya Gurukulam at Vedaranyam in 1946. The first women’s residential school in the Cauvery delta region started with only one student; it now serves nearly 2,000 girls, offering regular academic courses and skill-based programmes that help poor students from rural areas

title: Removing ‘₹’ in ‘T.N. Budget documents’ signals a dangerous mindset: Nirmala Sitharaman
content: It weakens Indian unity and promotes secessionist sentiments under the pretence of regional pride, says Finance Minister

title: Centre makes ‘quantum hubs’ operational
content: The Indian Institute of Technology in Kanpur has been designated as a management coordinating centre for four thematic hubs as part of the National Quantum Mission (NQM)

title: Prepare and finalise guidelines before announcing schemes in Budgets: Parliamentary panel to Urban Affairs Ministry
content: The committee made the recommendation with respect to two schemes announced in this year’s Budget — ‘Urban Challenge Fund’ and ‘Scheme for Industrial Housing’ with allocations of ₹10,000 crore and ₹2,500 crore, respectively

title: Manipur MP says question to Home Ministry on pacts with insurgent groups in Northeast ‘removed’
content: Mr. Akoijam posted about this online  social media platform X late on Wednesday night, saying he had met with Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla and Union Minister of Parliamentary Affairs Kiren Rijiju over this ‘unusual episode’

title: Watch: Sexual abuse & dismissal of 23 school staff in Tamil Nadu
content: This decision came after the department’s final investigation into 46 cases. It is part of an ongoing process where 104 cases were registered over the past decade.

title: Mosques in districts covered with tarpaulin, police remain on alert ahead of Holi
content: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath reviewed development projects and law and order at the Circuit House in Varanasi evening emphasising on maintaining peace and harmony during Holi celebrations

title: Kuki-Zo groups end shutdown of Manipur’s national highways
content: Kuki-Zo Council vows to continue opposition to the free movement of all in Manipur, seeks separate administration; highways had been shut since the death of a protestor in Kangpokpi clashes

title: Those who have issues with Holi colours should leave country, says Uttar Pradesh Minister
content: Muslim scholars reacted sharply over the statement made by Fisheries Minister Sanjay Nishad of creating division in society, spreading hatred, going against his oath, and inciting people

title: After early setbacks, Olive Ridley turtle nesting in the State sees significant recovery
content: Volunteers and the T.N. Forest Department have collectively gathered 2,53,719 turtle eggs across the State so far. As of March 11, Cuddalore tops the list with 89,784 eggs collected, followed by the Chennai division with 47,082 eggs

title: 28 children rescued from two brick kilns in West Bengal
content: The children from Bihar and Odisha were engaged as bonded labourers. They were found in appalling conditions. A social worker said that some of the children rescued were toddlers of barely three to four years of age.

title: Telangana Public Service Commission refutes allegations on Group-I Mains evaluation process
content: The Commission clarified that the evaluation was conducted with strict measures to ensure fairness and transparency

title: Kathua killings, ongoing probe do not point to terror angle, says government official
content: The official reasons that if a terror group had killed the three persons, including a teenage boy, then it would have claimed responsibility by now as Pakistani groups generally leave behind a message

title: Rights bodies urge Bombay High Court Chief Justice to stop authorities from banning stalls by Muslims at Kanifnath Yatra
content: The organisations have sought strict compliance and effective implementation of the order to enable safe and respectful working conditions for Muslim vendors

title: YSRCP leader opposes Vijaya Sai Reddy’s comments
content: Vijaya Sai Reddy used to speak for hours with YSRCP president Y.S. Jagan Mohan Reddy when he was the Chief Minister, and now making such claims was misleading, says Kakani Govardhan Reddy

title: Remnants of festivity removed from roads within hours
content: Corporation’s sanitation workers fan out across the city to clean up the debris left behind after Attukal Pongala

title: Cement companies told to strictly comply with rules pertaining to usage of Refuse Derived Fuel
content: According to the SWM rules, cement kilns should reduce the percentage of coal used and replace it with RDF derived from municipal solid waste, ensuring a minimum usage of 15% for cement production

title: Recount of votes must not compromise ballot secrecy, says SC
content: “Each vote has its own value irrespective of its effect on the final outcome of the election. Its sanctity has to be protected,” says Bench

title: Stone laid for entrance arch works of Bara Shaheed Dargah
content: Nellore Rural MLA asserts to continue his struggle for sanctioning of funds for the construction of the mosque

title: BJP stages protest against State Budget saying it is anti-Hindu, anti-farmer
content: Party leaders ride a bullock cart to the Belagavi Deputy Commissioner’s office and stage a rasta roko at the Rani Channamma Circle

title: Akali Dal to attend anti-delimitation meet in Chennai
content: SAD leader Daljit Singh Cheema and party’s working president Balwinder Bhunder will attend the meeting, the party said

title: State government approves user fee for waste collection
content: A senior BWSSB official said user fee will be collected through property tax and the escrow account will help timely payment of the bills to the contractors engaged in waste management

title: Over 3,200 PMJAY hospitals should be penalised for fraud, says NHA
content: Regulation needed to block hospitals using fraud as their business model, says Parliamentary panel on Health; calls for PMJAY to employ transparent, data-driven approach for quick interventions, fraud deterrence

title: Microsoft roped in for skilling youth in AI in Andhra Pradesh
content: AP State Skill Development Corporation (APSSDC) inks MoU with Microsoft for imparting skills to youth in AI and advanced technologies in vocational education

title: One-time settlement of loans to give big relief to farmers in Rajasthan
content: The long-term land development loans disbursed to the farmers and small entrepreneurs have played an important role in the agricultural and economic development of the State

title: Grand arrangements under way for Srinivasa Kalyanam in Amaravati
content: The event marks the beginning of Amaravati’s reconstruction, in line with the vision of Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu, says TTD Chairman

title: Indian National Army veteran Lt. Madhavan Pillai celebrates 99th birthday by paying tributes to Netaji and fallen soldiers
content: He joined the INA at the age of 17. His active involvement in the freedom struggle led to his imprisonment for eight months in Rangoon Jail from May to December 1945, officials said.

title: Excavations discover remains of dwellings alongside burial sites in Idukki, a first in Kerala
content: Pottery fragments, including black and red ware, black ware, coarse red ware, and russet-coated painted ware, iron fragments, terracotta discs, stone and glass beads, and iron slags discovered from Aanappara

title: Over 60 POCSO cases registered in Kozhikode in past two months
content: Legal awareness among children leads to an increase in the registration of cases; PTAs seek appointment of counsellors in all schools

title: Headmaster punishes himself for poor performance of students; Lokesh reacts
content: After pleading with the students with folded hands to perform better in exams, Chinta Ramana did a ‘Sastanga Namaskar’ and sit-ups

title: Enhanced housing aid to benefit 17,898 in Chittoor district
content: State government has announced additional financial assistance of ₹50,000 to ₹1 lakh per beneficiary to support the construction of housing units for people from SC/ST and OBC communities, says Collector

title: 52 non-locals granted domicile in J&K’s Budgam district: Minister
content: Responding to queries raised by National Conference (NC) legislator Shafi Wani, Minister for Health and Education Sakina Itoo told the J&K Assembly that these 52 individuals obtained domicile rights through marriage within the Beerwah area

title: CPI(M) condemns demolition of Kasinayana Satram
content: Government’s act of recklessly targeting the dining hall, which has been serving the poor, common people, and pilgrims for centuries, is shameful, says the party State secretary

title: Centre has failed to identify ‘genuine beneficiaries’ for rural housing scheme: Parliamentary panel report
content: The scheme still relies on 14-year-old data from Socio-Economic Caste Census (SECC) of 2011 to find beneficiaries and the gap is a serious deficiency in the scheme’s implementation and requires urgent rectification, the Parliamentary Standing Committee on Rural Development said in its report

title: Tomato processing unit at Dudekonda to offer job opportunities for youth, says APFPS official
content: Industries, Commerce, and Food Processing Minister to lay the foundation stone on Friday for the Integrated Tomato Processing Unit to be built at a cost of ₹11 crore

title: Yogi doing a Zia-ul-Haq on Holi in U.P., says Mehbooba Mufti
content: The Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister recently said those who want to offer Friday prayers can do so from their homes, in the wake of Holi falling on a Friday. For Muslims, Friday in the month of Ramzan is the day for congregational prayers.

title: Men's Bracketology: UNC, Xavier playing to remain in projected field
content: The Tar Heels improved their NCAA tournament hopes with Wednesday's second-round ACC tournament win over Notre Dame.

title: Flagg helped off with ankle injury; Duke survives
content: No. 1 Duke lost both Cooper Flagg (sprained left ankle) and Maliq Brown (dislocated shoudler) in the first half but held on to beat Ga. Tech in the ACC tournament.

title: Pickett says he will get chance to be Browns' QB1
content: The Browns' quarterback situation remains unsettled with few starting options available in free agency, but new addition Kenny Pickett said he has been told he will get the chance to compete to be QB1 in 2025.

title: Rays not moving forward with new stadium plans
content: The Tampa Bay Rays will not proceed with the development of a $1.3 billion baseball stadium in St. Petersburg, Florida, principal owner Stuart Sternberg said.

title: Source: Raiders agree to deal with RB Mostert
content: The Raiders have agreed to a one-year contract with veteran running back Raheem Mostert, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: QB Rudolph reuniting with Steelers, sources say
content: Quarterback Mason Rudolph is returning to the Steelers after a season with the Titans, agreeing to a two-year contract with the team that selected him in the 2018 draft, sources told ESPN.

title: Álvarez UCL penalty drama could see law change
content: UEFA said it'll "enter discussions with FIFA and IFAB" over a possible change to the rule that saw Julián Álvarez's penalty disallowed in Atlético Madrid's Champions League defeat to Real Madrid on Wednesday.

title: Red Sox's Giolito (hammy) to start season on IL
content: The Boston Red Sox will open the season with three starting pitchers on the injured list after right-hander Lucas Giolito strained his left hamstring.

title: Women's Bracketology: SDSU seals spot, but all eyes on Ivy Madness
content: With the final two teams in the field facing off Friday, the center of the Bracketology universe is Providence, Rhode Island.

title: From a South Carolina repeat to UConn ending its title drought: Six teams that could win it all
content: Sixty-eight teams will compete in  March Madness. But these six make up the short list of title contenders.

title: From $342.58 to over $1M, how some NFL players made out with performance bonuses
content: Brock Purdy nearly doubled his salary with performance-based pay, but other payouts were much more modest.

title: NHL playoff watch: Where will the Devils finish?
content: New Jersey currently holds the No. 3 seed in the Metro, but could drop to a wild-card spot -- or worse.

title: Quarterfinal predictions, from Real Madrid-Arsenal to Villa-PSG
content: While the dust settles on this week's drama, let's take an early look at how we think the next round will play out.

title: Brentford captain feared sleeping pill addiction
content: Brentford captain Christian Nørgaard has said he feared becoming addicted to sleeping pills after taking the medication to prepare for away games.

title: Simeone: 'Ball doesn't move' on disallowed pen
content: Diego Simeone questioned the decision to disallow Julián Álvarez's crucial penalty in Real Madrid's Champions League shootout win over Atlético Madrid, insisting "the ball doesn't move" after VAR decided the forward had kicked the ball twice.

title: UCL quarterfinals bracket set as Real face Arsenal
content: The Champions League quarterfinals bracket was set Wednesday, and it sends Real Madrid and Paris Saint-Germain toward more English teams standing in their path of the title.

title: Source: Álvarez 'incredulous' over penalty call
content: Julián Álvarez was "incredulous" after his penalty kick was disallowed in Atlético Madrid's Champions League round-of-16 defeat to Real Madrid, a source told ESPN.

title: Mbappé in France squad after 6-month absence
content: Kylian Mbappé on Thursday was included in Didier Deschamps' squad for France's Nations League quarterfinals March 20 and 23, after more than a six-month absence from the team.

title: Kimmich signs new Bayern contract until 2029
content: Joshua Kimmich has signed a contract extension to 2029 at Bayern, joining teammates Jamal Musiala and Alphonso Davies with fresh long-term deals.

title: Amorim 'in a hurry' to win trophies at Man Utd
content: Amorim has said he is "in a hurry" to win trophies at Man United while also admitting that the club heirachy recognise he needs time to deliver success

title: Dick Vitale hands out the only postseason awards that matter
content: With Cooper Flagg mentions galore, here are the best players of the 2024-25 men's college hoops season, according to Dick Vitale.

title: Watkins, Bueckers, Hidalgo headline All-America team -- but who's player of the year?
content: Our experts name their women's college basketball player of the year, All-Americans and biggest surprise.

title: The King, The Stilt and a Splash Brother: Meet the holders of the NBA's most unbreakable records
content: After LeBron James crossed the 50,000-point mark, and Stephen Curry about to surpass an unprecedented 4,000 three-pointers, here are other NBA records that, for now, look to be unbreakable.

title: Team-by-team preview: Can Orlando Pride repeat as champions?
content: With the National Women's Soccer League returning to action this weekend, we take a look at where the 14 clubs stands and how close each is to winning the NWSL championship.

title: From LaLiga to Premier League, the best title races and Champions League chases
content: Some title races (hello, Liverpool) appear over, but there's a lot of must-see races to watch down the stretch as trophies, top-four and relegation is all up for grabs.

title: Every way to bet on Alex Ovechkin's goals record chase
content: Alex Ovechkin is one of the hottest NHL bets, here are the special markets bettors can bet on as he closes in on the goals scored record.

title: Betting buzz: Steelers attract second-most Super Bowl bets this week
content: Bettors were on the Pittsburgh Steelers' Super Bowl odds after the acquisition of wide receiver DK Metcalf

title: Men's pound-for-pound rankings: Where does Bivol land after win? How about 'Tank' Davis?
content: A lot of movement in the top 10, including the return of Junto Nakatani, and Dmitry Bivol jumping over Artur Beterbiev. Here are the latest ESPN P4P rankings.

title: UFC expert picks, best bets: How Vettori can win in return from layoff
content: Who has the edge in this week's UFC Fight Night? An MMA coach and a betting insider make their picks.

title: PFL 2025: What are the fights and potential matchups to look forward to?
content: The new season of PFL brings new fighters and new weight classes. Here are the best matchups and the reason why you should watch.

title: Pasquantino? Alcantara? Cruz? 20 sleeper picks to target in 2025
content: Which players are Tristan H. Cockcroft higher on than most? Here's a list of 20 names to keep in mind when drafting your 2025 rosters.

title: Spicy meatballs? Space potatoes? 2025 MiLB alternate identities bring plenty of wild names
content: The trend of minor league teams adopting unique "alternate identities" for exclusive games or series is sweeping the nation.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United eye move for Éderson
content: Atalanta midfielder Éderson is at the top of Manchester United's transfer shortlist. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Promotes Secessionist Sentiments": N Sitharaman Slams DMK's Rupee Move
content: Union finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman has hit back at Tamil Nadu's ruling DMK over its move to replace the rupee symbol with the Tamil letter (Ru), declaring that it "promotes secessionist sentiments"

title: In Favour Of 30-Day Ceasefire With Ukraine, But "There Are Nuances": Putin
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin said Thursday he had "serious questions" about Washington's plan for a 30-day ceasefire in Ukraine but Moscow was ready to discuss it with US President Donald Trump.

title: In Putin's Ukraine Briefing, "Words Of Gratitude" For Trump, PM Modi
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday made his first comments on Washington's plan for a 30-day ceasefire in Ukraine.

title: 25-Year-Old Stops 3 Men From Applying Holi Colours, Choked To Death
content: A 25-year-old man was allegedly strangled to death in Rajasthan's Dausa district for trying to stop three men from applying colour on him ahead of Holi, police said on Thursday.

title: In Setback For Trump, Musk, US Judge Orders Agencies To Rehire Fired Workers: Report
content: A US judge on Thursday ordered six federal agencies to rehire thousands of probationary workers fired as part of Donald Trump's plan to slash the size of the government.

title: "Journalism Won't Be Silenced": Telangana Daily Publishes Blank Editorial
content: An Urdu daily in Telangana has published a blank editorial in protest against what it claims is the freezing of government advertisement by the Congress government led by Revanth Reddy.

title: Video: Headmaster Does 50 Sit-Ups Over Students' Performance, Indiscipline
content: In an environment where corporal punishment for students in schools is on the decline, the headmaster of a school in Andhra Pradesh has generated shock and awe by subjecting himself to it.

title: This City Is The World's Most Polluted. Hint: It's Not Delhi
content: A small city on the Meghalaya-Assam border, nearly 2,000 kilometres away from Delhi, is the most polluted in the world, according to a report published by a global pollution watchdog.

title: Video: Inside Look At Jagan Reddy's 'Sheeshmahal' In Andhra Pradesh
content: Aam Aadmi Party chief Arvind Kejriwal's "Sheeshmahal" that was one of the key focus areas in last month's Delhi election, has stiff competition from a house built for former Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Jagan Mohan Reddy.

title: "Discussed Diplomacy, Northeast, Football": John Abraham Meets S Jaishankar
content: Ahead of the release of his new film "The Diplomat", actor John Abraham on Thursday met External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar and discussed diplomacy, football, the northeast and the upcoming movie.

title: Star Aus Pacer Reignites CT 2025 'Unfair Advantage' Row: "When One Team..."
content: Australian cricket team star pacer Mitchell Starc believes that India had a clear advantage during the Champions Trophy 2025 as they played at just one venue.

title: How Mohali Parking Row Led To Scientist's Death. His Mother Narrates Horror
content: Dr Abhishek Swarnkar, the 39-year-old scientist who died in Mohali after being assaulted over a parking row, was attacked after he warned the accused that he would file a complaint against him

title: Ignored Pujara's Message To BCCI Ahead of England Tests: "If I Was..."
content: Veteran Indian cricket team batter Cheteshwar Pujara sent a strong message to the selectors ahead of the Test series against England.

title: Video: She Came To Buy Jewellery. Was Caught Popping Gold Pieces Into Mouth
content: Everyone appears busy at the store. The three shopkeepers are fending off queries and showing the jewellery pieces to the women. Outside, children, and people are going about their business in the pinched street.

title: NDTV Explains New Bill That Can Deny Foreigners Visas Over 'National Security'
content: Foreigners can be denied visas on national security grounds, their movements can be restricted, and they can be penalised for violating rules governing entry into, and exit from, India, according to a proposed law tabled by Home Minister Amit Shah.

title: 'Dangerous mindset': Sitharaman hits out at CM Stalin for replacing rupee symbol
content: Union finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman criticized Tamil Nadu's CM MK Stalin for removing the rupee symbol from the state budget's logo, labeling it as an act of regional chauvinism. The Tamil Nadu government replaced the symbol to oppose the Centre's three-language policy under NEP, intensifying the ongoing language dispute.

title: Train siege standoff still on? BLA refutes Pak army's claim
content: The Balochistan Liberation Army (BLA) claims it still holds hostages from the Jaffar Express, contrary to Pakistan military's statement of resolving the crisis. BLA alleges the military deceived the public and asserts ongoing conflict after Pakistan reported freeing 340 passengers, amid conflicting death toll reports.

title: Territory, tariffs and chaos: 10 ways Trump shook the world in 50 days
content: US President Donald Trump’s early moves in his second term disrupted global diplomacy, alienated allies, and uplifted rivals. Key changes included abandoning Ukraine, floating territorial expansions, pressuring Nato, and reducing foreign aid under Elon Musk’s guidance. This shift has heightened European defense discussions and empowered China and Russia on the global stage.

title: 'Come the big game ...': Karthik on Rohit & Virat's ability to rise to the occasion
content: Dinesh Karthik praised Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli for their match-winning performances in the ICC Champions Trophy and T20 World Cup finals, despite their prior form. He dismissed rumours of Rohit's retirement, lauding his legacy as a captain. Karthik expressed confidence in Yashasvi Jaiswal and Varun Chakaravarthy, and highlighted Shreyas Iyer's consistency under pressure.

title: Read Intel’s new CEO Lip-Bu Tan memo: It won’t be easy, but I am joining because…
content: Intel has named Lip-Bu Tan as its new CEO, with a vision to restore the company's industry standing. Tan emphasized a three-part philosophy and a focus on engineering excellence, customer satisfaction, and teamwork as key strategies to overcome recent challenges and drive future success.

title: Pakistan hints at India role in deadly train hijacking
content: Pakistan hints at India’s involvement in the Balochistan train hijacking, linking attackers to handlers in Afghanistan allegedly sponsored by India. The incident, implicating the Balochistan Liberation Army, left 58 dead and highlights ongoing regional tensions and security issues. Afghanistan rejects Pakistan’s claims, and India is yet to respond to the allegations.

title: Afghan officials walk out of talks with Pak counterparts over border standoff
content: Talks to resolve a border dispute between Pakistan and Afghanistan broke down after the Afghan delegation accused Pakistan of not taking negotiations seriously. The disagreement caused the suspension of cross-border trade and transit, with significant financial losses for both nations. Tensions escalated following an exchange of fire that injured eight people and damaged property.

title: Anupam Mittal on Singapore's Temasek buying 10% stake in Haldiram for $10 billion
content: Shark Tank India judge Anupam Mittal reacted to Temasek’s acquisition of a 9-10% stake in Haldiram's, valuing it at nearly $10 billion. This deal marks significant foreign investment in India's FMCG sector, with Temasek aiming to expand its footprint in the rapidly growing market.

title: Starmer abolishes NHS England to bring health service back under govt control
content: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer announced the abolition of NHS England to reduce bureaucracy and bring it under government control. This move is aimed at shifting funds to frontline services, such as hiring nurses and doctors, and improving patient care. The integration process will be completed in two years, reducing overall staff numbers by 50 percent.

title: Attack on Jandola military base repelled, 10 militants killed
content: Pakistan’s military thwarted a suicide attack on a Frontier Corps camp in Jandola, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, killing 10 TTP militants. The assault began with a massive explosion followed by a gun battle. No official casualty figures for security personnel or civilians were disclosed. This is the second major militant attack in Pakistan this week, highlighting rising regional security threats.

title: Elon Musk almost 'choking' in interview talking about Tesla struggles and…
content: Elon Musk, CEO of Tesla, expressed emotional strain in a Fox Business interview due to challenges with his companies and Tesla’s stock experiencing a significant decline. Increased government involvement and attacks on Tesla facilities have raised investor concerns. Musk managing multiple ventures with difficulty, as seen in the video, suggests he is under immense pressure.

title: Omar acknowledges relatives own Gulmarg hotel amid fashion show row
content: J&K CM Omar Abdullah confirmed relatives' ownership of the Gulmarg hotel linked to a controversial fashion show during Ramzan, amidst political backlash. BJP accused him of ties due to models staying at Nedous Hotel. Amid inquiry, organisers apologised, citing unintentional offense, and the CM assured action if laws were broken.

title: Revision of academic calendar among reforms in Intermediate education in Andhra Pradesh
content: e-Paper The Hindu On Books Books of the week, reviews, excerpts, new titles and features . health Matters Ramya Kannan writes to you on getting to good health, and staying there The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective .

title: Delhi tries last-resort attempt to appeal Sanjay Bhandari extradition verditc
content: The Indian government is seeking to appeal the London high court's decision to block the extradition of Sanjay Bhandari, citing breaches of Articles 3 and 6 of the ECHR. They argue that the burden of proof issue is not a denial of justice and that they should have been allowed to provide more assurances about Bhandari's treatment in Tihar jail.

title: Ctrl+C, Ctrl+V: Copy-paste syndrome afflicts J&K medical theses
content: A study by SKIMS Medical College in Srinagar has found that the acknowledgments in medical theses in J&K often use repetitive, copy-pasted phrases. Common expressions thanking guides and invoking divine blessings appear frequently, indicating a lack of originality. The study highlights concerns about the inventiveness and independent thinking of future doctors in their research.

title: J&K govt will promote religious, border tourism: Omar
content: Jammu and Kashmir CM Omar Abdullah has announced plans to transform Srinagar into a major tourist destination by promoting religious tourism and exploring lesser-known border spots like Gurez and Keran. With a focus on strengthening tourism infrastructure, the state has seen a rise in visitors, reaching 2.36 crore in 2024. Over 1,000 tourism projects have been completed this year.

title: 'Sensex may cross 1-lakh mark': 10 reasons why markets could rebound
content: Morgan Stanley maintains that India's long-term equity outlook is strong, despite recent market dips. Key factors include positive GDP projections, favorable inflation trends, RBI's easing measures, and increased foreign investment confidence. Market recovery in 2025 is predicted, though global economic fluctuations could pose risks.

title: Mumbai Indians crush Gujarat Giants to set up WPL title clash vs Delhi Capitals
content: Mumbai Indians advanced to their second Women's Premier League final after beating Gujarat Giants by 47 runs in the Eliminator. Nat Sciver-Brunt and Hayley Matthews scored 77 runs each, powering Mumbai to a total of 213 for four. Despite some resistance from Gujarat, Mumbai maintained their dominance, setting up a final against Delhi Capitals.

title: Trump says 'won't bend at all' on tariffs with Canada: 'Be our state, keep national anthem'
content: The US won't allow Canada ripping off anymore, Trump said. "We've been ripped off for years and we're not going to be ripped off anymore. No, I'm not going to bend at all -- aluminum or steel or cars," Trump told reporters when asked if he would back down. Trump said he loves Canada, Canada people but can't subsidize the country every year.

title: England batter Harry Brook faces two-year IPL ban
content: Harry Brook has been banned from the IPL for two seasons after pulling out of the 2025 edition. The BCCI enforces a two-year ban for overseas players who withdraw after being picked at the auction. Brook opted out to focus on his England career and recharge after a busy period, apologizing to Delhi Capitals and their fans.

title: Virat Kohli unveils stylish new look ahead of IPL 2025
content: Virat Kohli has revealed a new hairstyle ahead of IPL 2025, showcasing a side fade and signature quiff. His sharply groomed beard enhances his sophisticated and commanding presence. Known for his style both on and off the field, Kohli continues to set grooming trends, inspiring fans ahead of the cricket season.

title: Amid ongoing diplomatic chill, India & Bangladesh conduct naval exercise
content: Diplomatic tensions between India and Bangladesh persist, but their military cooperation remains robust. The recent 'Bongosagar' naval exercise showcased joint efforts to tackle maritime challenges and improve operational coordination, highlighting the ongoing strategic importance of collaboration despite regional geopolitical complexities.

title: Happy Holi 2025: Wishes, messages, quotes, and images
content: Celebrate this year’s Holi with all your friends and family, and forward them a lovely special from our curated Holi wishes and messages list. Make their day more blissful, filled with colours of joy and happiness.

title: Man tries to take a 'hot-pot' at the Yellowstone National Park, dies
content: Yellowstone National Park, renowned for its geothermal features, poses severe dangers in restricted areas. The tragic death of Colin Scott, who fell into a boiling acidic hot spring while filming, underscores the lethal risks of ignoring warnings. Despite posted signs, some visitors venture off trails, risking severe injuries or fatalities. Authorities urge adherence to the park's safety guidelines.

title: Solo Polyamory: How this new dating trend is redefining modern love
content: Solo Polyamory is a growing dating trend where individuals have multiple romantic partners without committing to any one of them. This lifestyle focuses on personal freedom and self-reliance, appealing to those who avoid conventional relationships. Despite the attraction to independence, participants might eventually face loneliness and a lack of deep connections impacting their mental well-being.

title: 'This chaos has to stop': Trump's tariffs prompt 'boycott USA' backlash
content: Trump's tariffs on steel and aluminum have led to an international boycott of US goods. European and Canadian consumers are rejecting American products in response to perceived unfair trade practices. The boycott has affected various industries, including liquor, automobiles, and tourism. If the boycott continues, American brands may need to rebrand or relocate manufacturing.

title: 'Gambhir had his style, I have my style': New KKR mentor Dwayne Bravo
content: Former West Indies cricketer Dwayne Bravo, now a mentor at Kolkata Knight Riders, aims to blend the successful strategies of his predecessor Gautam Gambhir with his own for the upcoming IPL. Bravo, who is excited about collaborating with Shah Rukh Khan and the KKR team, emphasises maintaining team stability and building on the previous season's success.

title: Yankees star Paul Goldschmidt reveals disappointed part of playing for Cardinals
content: Paul Goldschmidt expressed his time with the St. Louis Cardinals was mostly positive, but he was disappointed by their failure to win a World Series. Goldschmidt, now with the New York Yankees, reminisced about his career, which began with the Arizona Diamondbacks. His recent stats include 362 home runs, 2056 hits, and 1187 RBIs.

title: House of horror: US man drinks from toilet bowl as stepmom holds him captive for 20 years
content: A 32-year-old man in Connecticut was rescued after setting his house on fire to escape 20 years of captivity and abuse by his stepmother, Kimberly Sullivan. Having been held in an unheated, airless room, he endured severe malnutrition and unsanitary conditions. Sullivan faces charges including cruelty and kidnapping. The victim was found weighing less than 70 pounds.

title: Class 12 students missing Mar 15 Hindi exam due to Holi can take exam again
content: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has confirmed that the Class 12 Hindi board exams will proceed on March 15, 2025, despite potential Holi celebrations in some regions. However, students facing difficulties can opt for a rescheduled test. This aligns with CBSE’s existing policy for athletes, ensuring fairness while maintaining the examination schedule.

title: Days after train siege, terrorists attack army camp in Pakistan
content: Tehrik-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) executed a suicide attack on the Jandola military base in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, leading to the Pakistan Army killing eight to nine militants. Following the explosion, heavy gunfire ensued near the Frontier Corps camp in South Waziristan. This incident trails the Baloch Liberation Army's recent hijacking of the Jaffar Express in the Bolan Valley.

title: Holi-Jumma row: Mehbooba compares UP CM Yogi to Zia-ul-Haq
content: PDP chairperson Mehbooba Mufti criticized the Uttar Pradesh CM for allegedly creating divisions between Hindus and Muslims. She warned this division could deteriorate the communal harmony, similar to Pakistan under Zia-ul-Haq. With Holi coinciding with Ramzan, leaders advised Muslims to stay indoors to avoid conflict.

title: New rule for Canadians staying in the US for over 30 days amid Donald Trump's tariff war
content: Canadians who cross the northern border by land and stay for over 30 days do not need to register with the federal government. However, the new rule would require them to fill out a different form to enter the US, which is not a visa. Canadians never needed any form or visa to enter the US for casual travelling, tourism, shopping etc.

title: How Palestine activist Mahmoud Khalil exposed Trump & Musk on free speech
content: ​​Khalil’s arrest and possible deportation aren’t just about one man with an opinion the government doesn’t like; they’re about the bigger question of whether the First Amendment is truly for everyone or just for those who pass the political vibe check. If free speech really is the bedrock of democracy, why is a lawful permanent resident being shown the door for actually using it?

title: 'Most hostile': Trump threatens 200% tariff on European alcohol
content: US President Donald Trump has threatened to impose a 200 per cent tariff on French and European Union alcoholic products in response to the EU's 50 per cent tariff on American whiskey. The trade dispute escalates as the EU plans counter-tariffs worth €26 billion on various US goods.

title: 'You should have a replacement first': Sidhu backs Rohit to lead India in England Tests
content: Former cricketer Navjot Singh Sidhu supports Rohit Sharma as India's Test captain despite criticism over his recent form. Sidhu highlights Sharma's experience and previous successes, urging for a blend of seasoned players like Rohit, Virat Kohli, and KL Rahul with younger talents until the 2027 ODI World Cup to build a strong team.

title: 'CM acting like 9th Nizam': BJP on Holi celebration curbs in Hyd
content: Hyderabad police imposed restrictions for Holi celebrations, restricting group movement of vehicles and throwing colors on unwilling persons. BJP MLA Raja Singh criticized the move, calling it discriminatory and anti-Hindu, alleging influence from the Congress government. Restrictions are in effect from March 13 to March 15, with closure of wine shops and bars on March 14.

title: Stalin govt replaces Rupee symbol with Tamil letter; BJP mocks 'stupidity'
content: The Tamil Nadu government, led by MK Stalin, has replaced the Rupee symbol with the Tamil script 'ரூ' for the state's 2025-26 budget, sparking a renewed language debate with the Centre. BJP leaders criticized this decision, emphasizing the national significance of the Rupee symbol, initially designed by a Tamilian.

title: New TDS rules from April 1, 2025: Check out details
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman's Union Budget 2025 introduced significant modifications to TDS regulations. The changes include increased TDS thresholds for senior citizens, regular citizens, commission earners, and investors, effective from April 1, 2025.

title: Meet TN man who designed Rupee symbol & his DMK connection
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin replaced the rupee symbol with a Tamil script in the state budget amidst a controversy over 'Hindi imposition.' The rupee symbol was originally designed by Tamilian Udaya Kumar, whose work incorporated both Indian and universal design features.

title: UK scraps NHS England, puts healthcare mgmt back under govt control
content: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer announces that NHS England will be abolished, placing the NHS back under direct government control to cut bureaucracy and eliminate duplication. The decision aims to redirect funds to frontline services and bring NHS oversight back to politicians.

title: Khalil faces deportation: Should students in US with green cards be worried?
content: The arrest and potential deportation of Columbia graduate student Mahmoud Khalil have sparked outrage, raising concerns about green card holders’ rights in the US. Accused of posing a foreign policy risk, Khalil's pro-Palestinian activism led to his detention by ICE. A federal judge has temporarily blocked his deportation, but his future remains uncertain.

content: the Oklahoma City Thunder defeated the Boston Celtics 118-112 in a blockbuster matchup . the Western Conference-leading Thunder have improved their record against Eastern Conference teams to 22-1 . despite the team tying the NBA record for 3-point attempts, the Celtics faltered late .
